projects.name: Inventory Management System
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive Inventory Management System to efficiently manage inventory, dynamically update product and customer details, and streamline business operations achieving 40%. Enables Admin to manage customer information, including contact details, purchase history, and preferences, for efficient customer relationship management. Export reports to PDF or Excel formats. Automated inventory processes reduce manual work and errors, improving overall operational efficiency by up to 30%. Detailed reports and real-time data provide insights that aid in strategic decision-making.

projects.name: Rental Application
projects.description: Developed a web application for property and house rentals achieving 80% of the desired features, including property search, listing, and geo-location mapping features in the listing of the property post. Enables user to dynamically upload their property and get listed to the user who are searching them according to the requirements. This feature increased user to list a property by 50% listing. Allows users to access a secure authentication system and achieved them 80% efficient as expected.

experiences.description: Developed a fully responsive website that adapts perfectly to desktops, tablets, and mobile devices, leading to a 20% increase in mobile traffic. This ensures a seamless user experience across all devices dynamic and interactive elements like carousels or product configurators. This resulted in a 15% increase in user click-through rate on product pages. demonstrating a more engaging experience. Utilized Tailwind CSS, a pre-built CSS framework, to style web pages efficiently. This approach reduced development time by 30% compared to traditional methods, allowing for a faster website launch. Integrated JavaScript and SMTP.js to create a contact form. This facilitated communication between clients and management, leading to a 10% increase in contact form submissions for potential business leads.

full_output.name: V Subadevaeswaran
